tool.name: kMetaShot
tool.description: an alignment-free taxonomic classifier based on k-mer/minimizer counting
tool.command:
mkdir -p output bins &&
#if $bins_input.input_type == "collection": #for $file in $bins_input.bins_dir: ln -s '$file' 'bins/$file.element_identifier.$file.extension' && #end for #else: ln -s '$bins_input.contigs_file' 'bins/$bins_input.contigs_file.element_identifier.$bins_input.contigs_file.extension' && #end if
ls -la bins &&
kMetaShot_classifier_NV.py #if $bins_input.input_type == "collection": -b bins #else: -b 'bins/$bins_input.contigs_file.element_identifier.$bins_input.contigs_file.extension' #end if -o output -r '$reference.fields.path' -p \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4} -a ${ass2ref}

validator.message: No reference data for kMetaShot is installed. Please contact the Galaxy adminstrators to request one be installed.

param.label: Set ass2ref parameter
param.help: Ass2ref is a ratio between the number of MAG minimizers and the reference minimizers. It is a reliability index for strain classification only. Strain and Species classification for MAGs with ass2ref \<= user set threshold are zeroed

tool.help:
This tool is an alignment free taxonomic classifier for MAGs and/or contigs.
**Input**
Fasta file(s) in fasta format or/and fasta.gz format (.fa, .fasta, .fna, .fa.gz, .fasta.gz, .fna.gz are allowed extensions)
**Reference**
The reference data needed for this tool is provided from a data manager which always installed the latest version of the data
**Output**
The Output is a csv file(s) which contained the classification for the inputted bin(s)/MAG(s). In case ass2ref=0 you have only one output. In case ass2ref>0 you have two output, one for ass2ref=0 and one for ass2ref>0.
